Posted By: TravisBlanchard (6/27/2012 7:33:36 PM)

posts.post_content: The key is to have bigger & better creatures or artifacts than your opponents, eg. Deep-Sea Kraken, Kederekt Leviathan, Darksteel Colossus or whatever. Of course, if Braids dies before I put out my critters it's basically game over. Using a Vedalkin Orrery to play it with flash didn't really work for me - if anything it'd be better to play Braids earlier (with High Tide, say) when they wouldn't expect it.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This card is an essential card to have out in an [Eternal Dominion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternal Dominion) deck. It still allows you to play the majority of your permanents without actually playing them. Plus, this card paired with a [Paradox Haze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Paradox Haze) or two is just awesome anyways.  
I give it a 4.5

Posted By: GracefulInferno (3/25/2011 6:52:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Young Braids suffers like all the other cards which "share the love" with your opponents ([Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine), [Eladamri's Vineyard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eladamri's Vineyard), [Kami of the Crescent Moon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kami of the Crescent Moon) etc.) from the fact that you are the last player who gets rewarded. And being a creature increases the risk that she is gone and you get nothing when your next turn begins. That said, she guarantees great moments in multiplayer if she somehow sticks around.
  
You could try to play her at instant speed with [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir), [Winding Canyons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Winding Canyons) or [Vedalken Orrery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Orrery).
posts.html:
Young Braids suffers like all the other cards which "share the love" with your opponents (Howling Mine, Eladamri's Vineyard, Kami of the Crescent Moon etc.) from the fact that you are the last player who gets rewarded. And being a creature increases the risk that she is gone and you get nothing when your next turn begins. That said, she guarantees great moments in multiplayer if she somehow sticks around.
You could try to play her at instant speed with Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir, Winding Canyons or Vedalken Orrery.

posts.post_content:
It's too bad that she doesn't allow you to cast enchantments, cause [Omniscience](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Omniscience) would've been perfect :P

posts.post_content: Possibly not the most cost effective ever, but [Quicksilver Amulet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quicksilver Amulet) her at the end of your opponent's turn, then [Crystal Shard](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystal Shard) her before the end of your turn so she isn't around to share that love with anyone else. And combo with Paradox haze. 5 mana to pop two big beatsticks a turn down. Add a bucket load of card drawing and have fun. :-)

posts.post_content:
Play her with [Vanishing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vanishing) and phase her out at the end of your turn and she phases in at the beginning of your next turn then phase her out after she triggers/before the end of your turn.  
  
Two card [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell) combo in the same color except...your opponent doesn't get any of the benefit for the cost of ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) every turn.
posts.html:
Play her with Vanishing and phase her out at the end of your turn and she phases in at the beginning of your next turn then phase her out after she triggers/before the end of your turn.

Two card Show and Tell combo in the same color except...your opponent doesn't get any of the benefit for the cost of every turn.
